comment:
Nose: toffee, butterscotch, light to mild smoke, peanuts, earl gray tea 
Taste: Cherry, vanilla, touches of honey and herb

As soon as this hits the tip of your tongue, you get a nice sweet hit of the Pinot Noir. Then you move into the oak, caramel, and vanilla notes. The finish is long and the bite is fantastic at 123.10 proof. Very glad I picked this up before you could not longer find it in the wild.
